result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Guy E. Arbuckle was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is granted credit for time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
Obey the motor vehicle code. 
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Defendant Guy E. Arbuckle in court with attorney Richard S Gondik.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA has no comments and Atty has no corrections. no agreement for Sentencing. DA comments other then the fact that def is a serial Drunk driver is a good guy- no prior record that is not tied to driving. Has a lot of potential. Since he keeps offending the punishment goes up.. OWI 7 8 or 9 you go to prison. minim 3 years init confinement. DA request a sentence of def period of 3-5 years INIT with similar extended supervision. no minm fine. also a monetary payment 36 month revoke 36 month IID.  DOT AODA and follow through- absol, not present where mind altering sub's consumed, UA. other counseling, Cognitive, pay ct costs and DNA. Atty comments only reason this is a 8th because the def told them. Would thinks conditions are fair and minm sentence case. Def has a desire to clean up drinking and driving problem. Would ask for , a house to get ready for winter. Atty asks for a furlough to def can winterize home before he goes to prison. asking for mim amount of time. Atty comments 79 days credit. Ct comments no record of someone being injured or killed. Ct does not see this as a maxim sentence.6 years total  Ct orders 3 years init confinement. 3 years extended. Not elig for Challenge program but is eligible for substance abuse program. credit for time served 79 days is what atty has. DA comments. CT orders 77 days credit. conditions - absol, do not possess or consume mind alerint , pres as pres, no B,T,L's , cognitive therapy, AODA and follow through, obey the motor vehicle code, 36 month revoke, 36 month IID, DNA, Fine of 1379.00. furlough request is denied. No fire and no vote. UA and other counseling.

Defendant Guy E. Arbuckle in court with attorney Richard S Gondik.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA agreement plea to Ct2, Ct1 DRI request PSI and free to argue. Atty Gondik and def state that is agreement. Def plea NC, admits 7th,8th or 9th conviction, admits .17 or greater. Ct 1 DRI. Ct accepts plea and finds def guilty. Ct orders PSI, bail revoked def remanded to sheriffs department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Atty will not push for a PSI. Plea hearing for this date., Def stay in contact with atty  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
